ch.aplu.android.nxt

Class NxtRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.nxt.NxtRobot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TurtleRobot

    public class NxtRobot
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a NXT robot brick. Parts (e.g. motors, sensors) may be assembled into the robot to make it doing the desired job.

    More than one instance may be created. They are indentified by different Bluetooth names (or addresses).

    The Bluetooth communication uses the ch.aplu.android.bluetooth package.

    NxtJlib implements the usual Java event handling model using event listeners and adapters. The sensors are polled at a regular interval from a internal thread and the registered callback method is invoked, when the event condition is fullfilled (e.g. sensor value crosses a given trigger level).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NxtRobot.ConnectState
      Enum that defines return values for the connect() method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NxtRobot

        public NxtRobot(android.app.Activity activity,
        android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice nxtDevice)
        Creates a NxtRobot instance with given BluetoothDevice of the NXT brick. No connection trial is engaged until connect() is called.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity where to retrieve information about the Bluetooth adapter
        nxtDevice - a valid reference to the existing Bluetooth device

      • NxtRobot

        public NxtRobot(android.app.Activity activity,
        java.lang.String nxtName)
        Creates a NxtRobot instance with given Bluetooth friendly name of the NXT brick. A search of the Bluetooth device is engaged. If this search fails and verbose is turned on, a toast error message is displayed and connect() will fail. No connection trial is engaged until connect() is called.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity where to retrieve information about the Bluetooth adapter
        nxtName - the Bluetooth name of the NXT brick

      • NxtRobot

        public NxtRobot(android.app.Activity activity)
        Opens a GGInputDialog to ask for the Bluetooth friendly name of the NXT brick and creates a NxtRobot instance. A search of the Bluetooth device is engaged. If this search fails and verbose is turned on, a toast error message is displayed and connect() will fail. No connection trial is engaged until connect() is called.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity where to retrieve information about the Bluetooth adapter

    • Method Detail

      • setVerbose

        public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
        Show/hide verbose information about the Bluetooth search displayed as toast (default: true) when connect() is called.
        Parameters:
        verbose - if true, information is displayed

      • enableConnectMelody

        public void enableConnectMelody(boolean enable)
        Enables/disables melody played when the Bluetooth connection is established/broken (default: enabled).
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, a melody is played when the brick connects/disconnects

      • addPart

        public void addPart(Part part)
        Assembles the given part into the robot. If already connected, initialize the part.
        Parameters:
        part - the part to assemble

      • connect

        public NxtRobot.ConnectState connect()
        If the NXT name is not known, asks for the NXT Bluetooth friendly name. Connects the host to the NXT robot via Bluetooth. Initializes all parts already assembled. You should close the connection by calling exit() in order to reset the NXT brick to accept the next Bluetooth connection.
        Returns:
        one of the enums of ConnectState

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Closes the Bluetooth communication and resets the NXT brick to accept the next connection. You should invoke exit() in the onPause() notification, called when the GameGrid activity terminates. If you do not call exit(), the next Bluetooth connection to the brick will fail (unless you turn it off and then on again.

      • addNxtConnectionListener

        public void addNxtConnectionListener(NxtConnectionListener listener)
        Registers a connection listener to get notifications when the NXT bricks connects/disconnects.
        Parameters:
        listener - the NxtConnectionListener to register

      • playConnectMelody

        public void playConnectMelody()
        Plays a standard connect melody.

      • playDisconnectMelody

        public void playDisconnectMelody()
        Plays a standard disconnect melody.

      • requestData

        public byte[] requestData(byte[] request)
        Combines sendData() and readData() in synchronized block.
        Parameters:
        request - the data to send
        Returns:
        the brick's reply; null, if not connected

      • sendData

        public void sendData(byte[] command)
        Sends a direct command to the brick.
        Parameters:
        command - the data to send

      • readData

        public byte[] readData()
        Reads the data returned as a reply from the brick.
        Returns:
        the brick's reply

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection state.
        Returns:
        true, if connected, otherwise false

      • playTone

        public void playTone(int frequency,
            int duration)
        Plays a tone with given frequency (in Hertz) and duration (in seconds).

        Returns:

      • keepAlive

        public void keepAlive()
        Sends a keep alive command to prevent the automatic shutdown of the brick.

      • startProgram

        public boolean startProgram(java.lang.String filename)

      • findFirst

        public FileInfo findFirst()
        Start file enumeration in the brick's file system. For a file enumeration do the following
        Call findFirst(). It returns the FileInfo reference of the first file. If it returns null, there is no file and you can't proceed.
        Keep calling findNext() until it returns null, meaning there are no more files
        Returns:
        FileInfo reference giving details of the first file found or null if the search fails

      • findNext

        public FileInfo findNext(byte handle)
        Searches the next file in a file enumeration.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the previous found file
        Returns:
        FileInfo reference giving details of the file or null if the search fails

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists(java.lang.String filename)
        Searches for given file in the brick's file system.
        Returns:
        true, if file exists, otherwise false

      • delay

        public static void delay(int time)
        Halts current thread for the given amount of time.
        Parameters:
        time - the time the thread will sleep (in ms)

      • waitDisconnected

        public void waitDisconnected()
        Blocks the current thread until the Bluetooth link is disconnected.

      • waitDisconnected

        public boolean waitDisconnected(int timeout)
        Checks repeatedly if Bluetooth link is disconnected for the given maximum amount of time.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait (in ms)
        Returns:
        true, if already disconnected or disconnected within given timeout; false, if timeout occured before disconnection
